DD_Attribute.name: ancillary_product_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The ancillary_product_type element provides the type of data found in an ancillary product.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: IR spectroscopic technique in which placing a sample next to a high refractive index crystal causes total internal reflection resulting in an evanescent wave that samples shallow properties of the sample
An image of the sample
Elemental or oxide abundances for samples
Technique in which the sample is heated and temperature is monitored to evaluate exothermic and endothermic reactions that are indicative of composition
Microprobe technique in which the sample is bombarded with electrons, with resultant X-ray emission spectra indicative of sample composition
Sample mineral abundances defined as weight or volume percentages
Spectroscopic technique based on based on inelastic scattering of monochromatic light, usually from a laser source
Spectroscopic technique based on measuring the spectral properties of light scattered from samples
Technique in which sample mass is measured as its temperature is increased
Spectroscopic technique based on measuring the spectral properties of light transmitted through samples
X-rays diffracted by a sample as a function of incident angle are used to determine sample crystal structure
Spectroscopic technique in which the sample is bombarded by high-energy X-rays or gamma rays, with fluorescent X-ray emission spectra indicative of sample composition

DD_Attribute.name: data_producer_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The data_producer_name element provides the name of the creator of the product. For products in RELAB, the value of data_producer_name is always "RELAB".

DD_Attribute.name: data_provider_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The data_provider_name element provides the full name of the person who submitted the product to the library.

DD_Attribute.name: emission_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The emission_angle element provides the angle between the local vertical at the intercept point and a vector from the intercept point to the sensor.
DD_Attribute.comment: N/A for some measurement_geometry_types. Will make it optional in the class. Ralph M. says negative values are permitted; the sign indicates direction.

DD_Attribute.name: incidence_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The incidence_angle element provides the angle between the local vertical at the intercept point and a vector from the intercept point to the detector.
DD_Attribute.comment: N/A for some measurement_geometry_types. Will make it optional in the class. Ralph M. says negative values are permitted; the sign indicates direction.

DD_Attribute.name: instrument_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The instrument_name element provides a descriptive name of the instrument that made a spectral measurement.
DD_Attribute.comment: User-friendly name; should be unique within the label.

DD_Attribute.name: material_common_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The material_common_name element gives the specific name of the specimen material, as specifically as it is known. For example, if a specimen is pure olivine, put "Olivine". If a specimen is a mixture of kaolinite and opal, put "Kaolinite/Opal". Indicate if "Unidentified".
DD_Attribute.comment: I would like these to be searchable items/keywords. If something like "Kaolinite/Opal" is included, could it be found by only searching for "opal" or would it have to be specifically searched for as "Kaolinite/Opal"? (AZ) Changed this from material_identification and made it optional. (EG)

DD_Attribute.name: material_origin
DD_Attribute.definition: The material_origin element identifies whether the specimen is natural or synthetic.
DD_Attribute.comment: Is it possible to organize these specimen classification attributes so that the form changes depending on which option they choose? Or by doing away with the whole hierarchical system, does that no longer matter? We could also put a N/A option on each of the subtypes so that if something's not a mineral (or whatever it may not be), they just have to fill in N/A. I'm still a bit unsure about the non-hierarchical idea as it relates to the classification. Also, once something is marked as "Unclassified", it's not going to have any further classification. Will they just have to fill in N/A for everything else after that?

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Natural value indicates that the specimen was not made in a laboratory.
The Synthetic value indicates that the specimen was made in a laboratory. A synthetic sample could be either a physical mixture of natural materials or a laboratory synthesized material.

DD_Attribute.name: material_state
DD_Attribute.definition: The material_state element identifies the physical state of the specimen.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Solid value indicates that the specimen is in the solid state.
The Liquid value indicates that the specimen is in the liquid state.
The Gas value indicates that the specimen is in the gas state.

DD_Attribute.name: material_subtype
DD_Attribute.definition: The material_subtype element identifies the material subtype of the specimen.
DD_Attribute.comment: Material_subtype does not have enumerated values because there are too many to list. This is a place to put "Particulate" or "Nonparticulate" as RELAB suggests.

DD_Attribute.name: material_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The material_type element indicates the general type of the specimen.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Sample without crystalline structure or long range order, e.g., glass
Sample that is cemented or otherwise aggregated into a solid mass
Sample composed of a single element such as metallic iron
Solid sample composed of gas or liquid (e.g., water vapor or water) now in solid form
Sample with a given composition within a defined range of compositions and that exhibits a defined crystalline structure
Sample composed of organic materials
Solid sample composed of one or more minerals
Sample composed of a single particle
Sample of loose or disaggregated material that is a mixture of various minerals and/or other compounds

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_atmosphere_composition
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_atmosphere_composition element identifies any gas(es) present in measurement environment.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_atmosphere_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_atmosphere_description decribes the atmospheric conditions through which the data was taken.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_atmosphere_pressure
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_atmosphere_pressure element provides the atmospheric pressure of the measurement environment.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_atmosphere_relative_humidity
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_atmosphere_relative_humidity element provides the relative humidity of the measurement environment.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_atmosphere_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_atmosphere_temperature element provides the temperature of the measurement environment.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_date_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_date_time element identifies the date and time of the observation and measurement.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_geometry_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_geometry_type element identifies the type of geometry at which a measurement is taken.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Measurement taken when light is sent in to the specimen at a narrow angular range and received over a narrow angular range
Measurement taken when light is sent in to the specimen at a certain direction and received in all directions (perhaps in an integrating sphere).
Measurement taken when light is sent in to the specimen at all directions and received in all directions (perhaps in an integrating sphere)
Measurement taken when light is sent in to the specimen at a certain direction and in a cone-like shape and received at a certain direction and in a cone-like shape.
The measurement geometry is unknown.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_notes
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_notes element contains relevant notes about how a measurement was made.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_reference_standard
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_reference_standard element identifies the standard object on which observations are performed in order to calibrate a measurement.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_requestor
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_requestor element identifies the individual or laboratory who requested the measurement. It may occur more than once.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_segments
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_segments element gives the number of measurement segments that were combined to create the spectrum. If the spectrum is not merged from multiple segments, then the value of measurement_segments is 1.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_source_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_source_description element identifies the source used for the measurement such as the type of lamp, heating element, laser, or radioactive source.

DD_Attribute.name: measurement_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The measurement_type element identifies the type of spectroscopy performed on a specimen.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Reflectance value indicates reflectance spectroscopy, the study of light as a function of wavelength that has been reflected or scattered from a material.
The Emission value indicates emission spectroscpy, which examines the wavelengths emitted by atoms or molecules during their transition from an excited state to a lower energy state.
The Raman value indicates Raman spectroscopy, which determines information about a material by studying the Raman scattering of monochromatic light off the material.
The X-Ray Fluorescence value indicates x-ray flourescence spectroscopy, which examines the emission of x-rays from a material previously bombarded with high energy x-rays or gamma rays.
The X-Ray Diffraction value indicates x-ray diffraction spectroscopy, which studies the diffraction patterns of x-rays scattered off a material.
LIBS (Laser-Induced Breakdown Spectroscopy) uses a highly energetic laser pulse as its excitation source to produce emission spectra.
The Transmission value indicates transmission spectroscopy, the study of light as a function of wavelength that has been transmitted through a material.

Attenuated total reflectance (ATR) is a sampling technique used in conjunction with infrared spectroscopy which enables samples to be examined directly in the solid or liquid state without further preparation.

DD_Attribute.name: mineral_subtype
DD_Attribute.definition: The mineral_subtype element identifies the mineral subtype of the specimen.
DD_Attribute.comment: Mineral_subtype does not have enumerated values because there are too many to list.

DD_Attribute.name: mineral_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The mineral_type element identifies the type of mineral to which the specimen belongs.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Arsenate value indicates the specimen is an arsenate.
The Borate valeu indicates the specimen is a borate.
The Carbonate value indicates the specimen is a carbonate.
The Chromate value indicates the specimen is a chromate.
The Cyclosiliate value indicates the specimen is a sorosilicate.
The Halide value indicates the specimen is a halide.
The Hydroxide value indicates the specimen is a hydroxide.
The Inosilicate value indicates the specimen is a inosilicate.
The Iodate value indicates the specimen is an iodate.
The Native Element value indicates the specimen is a native element or an alloy.
The Nesosiliacte value indicates the specimen is a nesosilicate.
The Nitrate value indicates the specimen is a nitrate.
The Organic Compound value indicates the specimen is an organic compound.
The Oxide value indicates the specimen is an oxide.
The Phosphate value indicates the specimen is a sulfate.
The Phyllosilicate value indicates the specimen is a phyllosilicate.
The Sorosilicate value indicates the specimen is a sorosilicate.
The Sulfate value indicates the specimen is a sulfate.
The Sulfide value indicates the specimen is a sulfide.
The Tectosilicate value indicates the specimen is a tectosilicate.
The Unclassified value indicates that the specimen doesn't fit into any of these categories, but is still a mineral.
The Vanadate value indicates that the specimen is a vanadate.

DD_Attribute.name: organic_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The organic_type element identifies the organic type to which the specimen belongs.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Inorganic value indicates the specimen is not an organic material.
The Organic value indicates the specimen is an organic material.
The Mixture value indicates the specimen is a mixture of organic and inorganic material.

DD_Attribute.name: phase_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The phase_angle element provides the angle between incidence and emission vectors.
DD_Attribute.comment: N/A for some measurement_geometry_types. Will make it optional in the class. Ralph M. says negative values are permitted; the sign indicates direction.

DD_Attribute.name: processing_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The processing_description element provides information about how measurement(s) for a particular product were made, in addition to the information given in the Measurement Parameters class. In the case of a product created by merging multiple measurements, this element describes how the merge was done.

DD_Attribute.name: rock_subtype
DD_Attribute.definition: The rock_subtype element identifies the rock subtype of the specimen.
DD_Attribute.comment: Rock_subtype does not have enumerated values because there are too many to list.

DD_Attribute.name: rock_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The rock_type element identifies the type of rock the specimen is.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Igneous value indicates that the specimen is volatile-poor and was formed by the cooling of magma or lava.
The Sedimentary value indicates that the specimen was formed by sedimentary processes (e.g., lithification of unconsolidated material, direct chemical precipitation)
The Metamorphic value indicates that the specimen was formed by metamorphic processes (e.g., increased temperature and/or pressure conditions that altered the rock composition without melting)
The Unknown value indicates that there is not enough information about the specimen to assign it a rock type

DD_Attribute.name: segment_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The segment_number element identifies which segment of a merged spectrum is described by a Measurement_Parameters class. The first segment is segment number 1. If the spectrum is not merged from multiple segments, then the value of segment_number is 1.

DD_Attribute.name: source_specimen_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The source_specimen_id element identifies the source specimen from which the observed specimen is derived.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_collection_location
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_collection_location element provides the place where the specimen was collected.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_owner_location
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_owner_location element provides the institution or laboratory name where the specimen resides.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_owner_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_owner_name element identifies the individual or laboratory to whom the specimen belongs.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_description element provides a short description of the specimen.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_id element uniquely identifies the specimen.
DD_Attribute.comment: Unique within what group? This is not a LID because a specimen is not a PDS product. It's used to relate multiple measurements of the same specimen.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_max_size
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_max_size element identifies the maximum particle size of the observed specimen.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_min_size
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_min_size element identifies the minimum particle size of the observed specimen.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_name element identifies the specimen as it is named where it is being kept.
DD_Attribute.comment: The name is typically assigned by the specimen owner or data provider. It is not guaranteed to be unique. Use specimen_id for the unique identifier.

DD_Attribute.name: specimen_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The specimen_type element gives one or more terms that classify the origin of the specimen.
DD_Attribute.comment: Permissible values include relevant PDS4 Target_Identification types. More specific types to be added as needed.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Terrestrial value means the specimen is a terrestrial sample.
The Lunar Meteorite value means the specimen is a sample from a lunar meteorite.
The Mars Meteorite value means the specimen is a sample from a Mars meteorite.
The Other Meteorite value means the specimen is a sample from a meteorite that is not a lunar or Mars meteorite.
The Returned Lunar Sample value means the specimen is a lunar sample returned by a mission.
The Returned Asteroid Sample value means the specimen is an asteroid sample returned by a mission.
The Synthetic Sample value means the specimen is a laboratory-generated sample.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_range_max
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_range_max element identifies the maximum value at which a given data item was sampled. For example, a spectrum that was measured in the 0.4 to 3.5 um spectral range would have a spectral_range_max value of 3.5.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_range_min
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_range_min element identifies the minimum value at which a given data item was sampled. For example, a spectrum that was measured in the 0.4 to 3.5 um spectral range would have a spectral_range_min value of 0.4.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_range_parameter_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_range_parameter_name element identifies the name of the parameter which determines the sampling interval of the measurement.
DD_Attribute.comment: If it would be possible for there to be another option that I'm not currently aware of, is it possible to have an "other" option that then can be filled in and added to the search list of the database site? Also, these particular values are fairly self-explanatory (i.e. if you're looking at spectra and don't know what wavelength is.....), is the value_meaning tag a necessary component of the definition, and if so, what would you suggest putting in its place? EAG - These 4 are a good start. If others are needed, we can revise the dictionary to add it.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Wavelength value means the spectrum is a function of wavelength.
The Frequency value means the spectrum is a function of frequency.
The Wavenumber value means the spectrum is a function of wavenumber.
The Time value means the spectra is a function of time.
The Angle value means the spectra is a function of angle.
The Energy value means the spectra is a function of energy.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_range_unit_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_range_unit_name element identifies the unit of measure for the values specified by spectral_range_min and spectral_range_max.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_resolution_width_max
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_resolution_width_max element identifies the maximum width of a spectral band in a given spectrum. If all bands are the same width, spectral_resolution_width_min and spectral_resolution_width_max will have the same value.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_resolution_width_min
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_resolution_width_min element identifies the minimum width of a spectral band in a given spectrum. If all bands are the same width, spectral_resolution_width_min and spectral_resolution_width_max will have the same value.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_resolution_width_unit_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_resolution_width_unit_name element identifies the unit of measure for the values specified by spectral_resolution_width_min and spectral_resolution_width_max.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_sampling_interval_max
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_sampling_interval_max element identifies the maximum distance between band centers in a given spectrum. If all band centers are equally spaced, spectral_sampling_interval_min and spectral_sampling_interval_max will have the same value.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_sampling_interval_min
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_sampling_interval_min element identifies the minimum distance between band centers in a given spectrum. If all band centers are equally spaced, spectral_sampling_interval_min and spectral_sampling_interval_max will have the same value.

DD_Attribute.name: spectral_sampling_interval_unit_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The spectral_sampling_interval_unit_name element identifies the unit of measure for the values specified by spectral_sampling_interval_min and spectral_sampling_interval_max.

DD_Attribute.name: synthetic_processing_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The synthetic_processing_description element describes how a synthetic specimen has been processed.

DD_Attribute.name: synthetic_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The synthetic_type element identifies the process by which the specimen was produced synthetically.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Sample that is entirely human-made
Sample that is a mixture of human-made and naturally occurring components
A natural product chemically or mineralogically altered by a laboratory treatment (e.g., heating). Does not include size and magnetic separates of natural samples or washing by water.
Portions of an instrument, e.g., portions of a spectrometer that contribute to a spectroscopic signature and thus need to be characterized

DD_Attribute.name: volatile_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The volatile_type element indicates whether the material was volatile-poor (less than 2.0% LOI) or volatile-rich (greater than 2.0% LOI).

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The Poor value indicates the specimen had less than 2.0% LOI.
The Rich value indicates the specimen had greater than 2.0% LOI.
The Unknown value indicates the specimen's volatile type is unknown.

DD_Class.name: Measurement_Instrument
DD_Class.definition: The Measurement_Instrument class contains attributes that identify the instrument that made the measurement.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The measurement parameters are relevant to the instrument identified by the given LID.

DD_Class.name: Measurement_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Measurement_Parameters class contains attributes relevant to a single measurement of a specimen.

DD_Class.name: Specimen_Classification
DD_Class.definition: The Specimen_Classification class provides information about how a specimen has been classified.

DD_Class.name: Specimen_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Specimen_Parameters class provides information about a specimen for which measurements have been made.

DD_Class.name: Ancillary_Product
DD_Class.definition: The Ancillary_Product class identifies an ancillary measurement related to a Spectral Library specimen.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The data product has an associated ancillary data product identified by the given LID.

DD_Class.name: Spectral_Library_Product
DD_Class.definition: The Spectral_Library_Product class provides information about a data product in the Spectral Library.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: speclib_measurement_segments_rule: The value of the attribute measurement_segments must equal the number of occurrences of the class Measurement_Parameters.
speclib_measurement_instrument_rule_0: In the Measurement_Instrument/Internal_Reference class, the value of the reference_type attribute must be "is_instrument".
speclib_measurement_parameters_rule_0: speclib:spectral_range_min must be less than or equal to speclib:spectral_range_max.
speclib_specimen_parameters_rule_0: speclib:specimen_min_size must be less than or equal to speclib:specimen_max_size.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: (speclib:material_state = 'Solid' and speclib:material_type and (speclib:material_subtype = 'Particulate' or speclib:material_subtype = 'Nonparticulate')) or (speclib:material_state != 'Solid')
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: speclib_classification_rule_solid_material: In the Specimen_Classification class, if material_state is Solid, then the attributes material_type and material_subtype must be present, and material_subtype must include either Particulate or Nonparticulate.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: (speclib:material_state = 'Solid' and speclib:material_type = 'Organic' and speclib:organic_type = 'Organic') or (speclib:material_state = 'Solid' and speclib:material_type != 'Organic') or (speclib:material_state != 'Solid')
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: speclib:classification_rule_organic_material: In the Specimen_Classification class, if material_type is Organic, then the attribute organic_type must also be Organic.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: (speclib:material_state = 'Solid' and speclib:material_type = 'Mineral' and speclib:mineral_type) or (speclib:material_state = 'Solid' and speclib:material_type != 'Mineral') or (speclib:material_state != 'Solid')
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: speclib_classification_rule_mineral: In the Specimen_Classification class, if material_type is Mineral, then the attribute mineral_type must be present.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: (speclib:material_state = 'Solid' and speclib:material_type = 'Rock' and speclib:rock_type) or (speclib:material_state = 'Solid' and speclib:material_type != 'Rock') or (speclib:material_state != 'Solid')
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: speclib_classification_rule_rock: In the Specimen_Classification class, if material_type is Rock, then the attribute rock_type must be present.
speclib_classification_rule_material_subtype: In the Specimen_Classification class, if the attribute material_subtype is present, then the attribute material_type must also be present.
speclib_classification_rule_mineral_subtype: In the Specimen_Classification class, if the attribute mineral_subtype is present, then the attribute mineral_type must also be present.
speclib_classification_rule_rock_subtype: In the Specimen_Classification class, if the attribute rock_subtype is present, then the attribute rock_type must also be present.

speclib_classification_rule_synthetic: In the Specimen_Classification class, if material_origin is Synthetic, then the attribute synthetic_type must be present. If material_origin is not Synthetic, then the attribute synthetic type must not be present.
